headers.subject: [away3d] Broomstick Procedural 3D Content
headers.received: by pvc30 with SMTP id 30sf536990pvc.15 for <google.larry.sergey@a.markmail.org>; Thu, 14 Apr 2011 08:03:59 -0700 (PDT)
by n2g2000prj.googlegroups.com with HTTP; Thu, 14 Apr 2011 08:03:48 -0700 (PDT)
headers.x-http-useragent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/10.0.648.204 Safari/534.16,gzip(gfe)

body.para: Hi Group- I'm trying to figure out Broomstick using example code for 3.6 but it is so different I am having a hard time getting started. I want to generate my own mesh geometry procedurally, but methods like createVertex, createFace, and regularPolygon no longer seem to exist in Broomstick.
For instance a simple pyramid shape with a square base- 5 vertices, 6 triangles. What is the approach in Broomstick to make it without the methods in 3.6 I mentioned above?
